Course ID: DANI_V 110, Course Title: Elementary Danish II, Course Description: Students with native or near-native proficiency in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Danish, Norwegian, Swedish) cannot participate in the elementary Danish courses (DANI 100 and DANI 110), but are welcome to join the intermediate courses (DANI 200 and DANI 210)., Credits: 	3

Course ID: NORD_V 334, Course Title: Nordic Contemporary Fiction, Course Description: Explore Nordic societies through recent literature translated from Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Smi languages, Icelandic, and other Nordic languages. Credit will be granted for only one of SCAN 334 or NORD 334., Credits: 	3

Course ID: SWED_V 100, Course Title: Elementary Swedish I, Course Description: Students with native or near-native proficiency in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Danish, Norwegian, Swedish) cannot participate in the elementary Swedish courses (SWED 100 and SWED 110), but are welcome to join the intermediate courses (SWED 200 and SWED 210)., Credits: 	3

Course ID: SWED_V 110, Course Title: Elementary Swedish II, Course Description: Students with native or near-native proficiency in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Danish, Norwegian, Swedish) cannot participate in the elementary Swedish courses (SWED 100 and SWED 110), but are welcome to join the intermediate courses (SWED 200 and SWED 210)., Credits: 	3

Course ID: ASIA_V 348, Course Title: Poetic Life in Classical India, Course Description: Cultural explorations in the poetry, theatre, and ornate prose writings of India in the classical period (c. 300-1300 CE)., Credits: 	3

Course ID: ASIA_V 454, Course Title: Japanese Poetry in Translation, Course Description: An introduction to Japanese poetry from its origins in song and myth, to its development from a courtly art (waka) to a popular pastime (haiku). Influences on prose, autobiography, and theatre will also be considered., Credits: 	3

Course ID: CRWR_V 312, Course Title: Interactive Storytelling, Course Description: Origin, theory and practice of interactive story forms. Exploring structural links between interactive theatre, gaming, and extended (virtual, mixed, and augmented) reality. Prerequisite: CRWR 213., Credits: 	3

Course ID: FREN_V 311, Course Title: Introduction to Literature in French, Course Description: Critical reading of foundational literary texts in French from genres of prose fiction, non-fiction, poetry, and theatre. Prerequisite: One of FREN 123, FREN 302., Credits: 	3

Course ID: MUSC_V 336, Course Title: Opera Theatre Techniques I, Course Description: Performance techniques associated with the musical theatre of various historical periods. Basic dance. Most operatic excerpts will be in English., Credits: 	4

Course ID: PUNJ_V 457, Course Title: Punjabi Theatre, Course Description: Punjabi-language theatre, with emphasis on Canadian forms. Reading, writing, and performance of plays; examination of history of Punjabi theatre. Recommended pre-requisite: PUNJ 300., Credits: 	3

Course ID: RMST_V 302, Course Title: Theatre and Poetry of the Romance World, Course Description: Theatre and poetry of the Romance-speaking world from the Middle Ages to the present day from a comparative perspective., Credits: 	3

Course ID: SPAN_V 409, Course Title: From Text to Stage: Topics in Hispanic Theatre, Course Description: Selected areas of study relating to Hispanic Theatre. Consult the Department for this year's offerings. Recommended pre-requisites: SPAN 221; and SPAN 301 or equivalent expertise in written and spoken Spanish., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 271, Course Title: Beginning B.F.A. Acting I, Course Description: Open only to B.F.A. Acting students. An audition is required. Prerequisite: At least one theatre course., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 273, Course Title: Beginning Voice and Movement I, Course Description: Open only to B.F.A. Acting students. An audition is required. Prerequisite: At least one theatre course., Credits: 	3
Course ID: THTR_V 299, Course Title: Production I, Course Description: Assigned projects in theatre production. Corequisite: One of THTR 205, THTR 250. Equivalency: THTR251, Credits: 	3-6
Course ID: THTR_V 320, Course Title: History of Theatre I, Course Description: Core concepts in world theatre history and the development of theatre prior to the nineteenth century., Credits: 	3
Course ID: THTR_V 420, Course Title: History of Theatre II, Course Description: Key movements in world theatre history from the nineteenth century to the present. Prerequisite: THTR 320., Credits: 	3
Course ID: THTR_V 421, Course Title: History of Theatre from 1900 to the present, Course Description: The development of Western Theatre from 1900 to the present, Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 440, Course Title: Topics in Theatre, Course Description: An examination in depth of a selected area of theatre history, theory or practice. Topics will change from year to year. May be repeated for credit when topics differ. Prerequisite: 6 credits of THTR at the 300-level or above., Credits: 	3-6

Course ID: THTR_V 443, Course Title: Women in Theatre and Film, Course Description: A course dealing with women's involvement in and contribution to various aspects of Theatre and/or Film Topics will change from year to year. Equivalency: THTR415, Credits: 	3-6

Course ID: THTR_V 454, Course Title: Production and Theatre Management, Course Description: Production and theatre management with emphasis on budgeting, publicity, scheduling, press relations, special events, legal issues, season selection, resumes and interpersonal skills. Prerequisite: [THTR354], Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 505, Course Title: Scenery Design Studio I, Course Description: Scenery design for theatre and other performance forms. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 506, Course Title: Costume Design Studio I, Course Description: Costume design for theatre and other performance forms. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 507, Course Title: Scenery Design Studio II, Course Description: Complex scenery design for opera, dance, theatre, and other performance forms. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 508, Course Title: Costume Design Studio II, Course Description: Complex costume design for opera, dance, theatre, and other performance forms. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THTR_V 530, Course Title: Seminar: Relationships Between Theatre and the Other Arts, Course Description: Studies in a selected area of theatre in relation to one or more of the other arts. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3-6

Course ID: THTR_V 550, Course Title: Studies in Historic Design, Course Description: Seminar in theatre scenery, costumes, and architecture of selected historical periods. Pre- or co-requisite: THTR 505 and THTR 506. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	6

Course ID: THTR_V 551, Course Title: Lighting Design Studio 1, Course Description: Lighting design for theatre and other performance forms. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THFL_V 100, Course Title: The Art of Storytelling for Stage and Screen, Course Description: Fundamental elements of the art of storytelling as approached within each of the core areas taught in the Department of Theatre and Film: Acting/Directing, Design and Production, and Film Production. Restricted to students in one of the following BFA programs: Major in Acting; Major in Film Production; Major in Theatre Design and Production, Credits: 	3

Course ID: THFL_V 402, Course Title: Professional Portfolio Preparation for Live and Digital Performance, Course Description: Preparation to transition into the theatre and film industry. Portfolio development, visual identity, and skills to support professional performance practices aligned with theatre and film professional associations. Restricted to students in third or fourth-year in one of the following programs: Major in Film Production; Major in Theatre Design and Production. Prerequisite: One of THTR 305, THTR 306, THTR 307, THTR 308, FIPR 333., Credits: 	3

Course ID: THFL_V 599, Course Title: Production, Course Description: Assigned projects in Theatre and Film design and production. Restricted to students in the MFA THTR and MFA FIPR programs. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading. This course is not eligible for Credit/D/Fail grading., Credits: 	3

prompt: Tell me about Urban Systems courses.
completion: Course ID: ENVR_V 420, Course Title: Ecohydrology of Watersheds and Water Systems, Course Description: Analysis of water resources from a water-in-ecosystem perspective. Application to natural, managed, and urban systems, considering ecological interactions with hydrological processes. Exploration of biogeochemical processes related to water quality, and human impacts on water resources. [3-0-0] Prerequisite: Third or fourth-year standing in Science, Applied Science, Land and Food Systems, or Forestry., Credits: 	3
